alert.note: Alert for Southern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 3:18PM EST until February 23 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches in most areas with ice accumulations of a tenth to a quarter of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, and east central and eastern New York including the Capital District, Helderbergs, Taconics, Catskills, Mohawk and Schoharie Valleys and portions of the mid-Hudson Valley. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact today`s evening commute and the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop by late afternoon today, then change to sleet and freezing rain from south to north later tonight. Snowfall rates of 0.50 to 1.0 inch per hour may occur this evening. The heaviest snow and most icing will likely occur over higher elevations and across the northern part of the advisory area near I-90.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
